metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1000223 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
soundtouch version up to and including 2.0.0 contains a Buffer Overflowvulnerability in SoundStretch/WavFile.cpp:WavInFile::readHeaderBlock() thatcan result in arbitrary code execution. This attack appear to beexploitable via victim must open maliocius file in soundstretch utility.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000223` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsoundtouch0 - 1.7.1-5ubuntu0.1~esm1
soundstretch - 1.7.1-5ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: soundtouch package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.7.1-5ubuntu0.1~esm1').
